Column 1 (Variable) has: Wages, Salaries, Stock, Revenue, Direct costs;
Column 2 (Budgeted$) has: 4000, 4500, 1800, 15750, x
Column 3 (Actual$) has: 4200, 4500, 1850, x, 2950
Column 4 (Variance$) has: 200, 0, 50, 290, 250
Column 5 (Variance F/A) has: Favourable, Favourable, Favourable, Favourable, Favourable

Therefore, the values of "x" are:

* Column 2, Row 5 (Direct costs): 13,260 (15750-2490)
* Column 3, Row 4 (Revenue): 12,460 (15750-3290)
* Column 4, Row 1 (Wages): 200 (Actual$ - Budgeted$ = 4200 - 4000)
* Column 4, Row 3 (Stock): 50 (Actual$ - Budgeted$ = 1850 - 1800)
